text: Also you shall keep the Feast of the Harvest of the first fruits of your labors from what you sow in the field; also the Feast of the Ingathering at the end of the year when you gather in the fruit of your labors from the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three times a year all your males shall appear before the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with leavened bread; nor is the fat of My feast to remain overnight until morning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“You shall bring the choice first fruits of your soil into the house of the Lord your God.
“You are not to boil a young goat in the milk of its mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Behold, I am going to send an angel before you to guard you along the way and to bring you into the place which I have prepared.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be attentive to him and obey his voice; do not be rebellious toward him, for he will not pardon your rebellion, since My name is in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you truly obey his voice and do all that I say, then I will be an enemy to your enemies and an adversary to your adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text: For My angel will go before you and bring you into the land of the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Canaanites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites; and I will completely destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not worship their gods, nor serve them, nor do according to their deeds; but you shall utterly overthrow them and break their memorial stones in pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall serve the Lord your God, and He will bless your bread and your water; and I will remove sickness from your midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: There will be no one miscarrying or unable to have children in your land; I will fulfill the number of your days.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will send My terror ahead of you, and throw into confusion all the people among whom you come, and I will make all your enemies turn their backs to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will send hornets ahead of you so that they will drive out the Hivites, the Canaanites, and the Hittites from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not drive them out from you in a single year, so that the land will not become desolate and the animals of the field become too numerous for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will drive them out from you little by little, until you become fruitful and take possession of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will set your boundary from the Red Sea to the sea of the Philistines, and from the wilderness to the Euphrates River; for I will hand over the inhabitants of the land to you, and you will drive them out from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make no covenant with them or with their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not live in your land, otherwise they will make you sin against Me; for if you serve their gods, it is certain to be a snare to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to Moses, “Come up to the Lord, you and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel, and you shall worship at a distance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses alone, however, shall approach the Lord, but they shall not approach, nor shall the people come up with him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses came and reported to the people all the words of the Lord and all the ordinances; and all the people answered with one voice and said, “All the words which the Lord has spoken we will do!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses wrote down all the words of the Lord. Then he got up early in the morning, and built an altar at the foot of the mountain with twelve memorial stones for the twelve tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sent young men of the sons of Israel, and they offered burnt offerings and sacrificed bulls as peace offerings to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses took half of the blood and put it in basins, and the other half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he took the Book of the Covenant and read it as the people listened; and they said, “All that the Lord has spoken we will do, and we will be obedient!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses took the blood and sprinkled it on the people, and said, “Behold the blood of the covenant, which the Lord has made with you in accordance with all these words.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses went up with Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they saw the God of Israel; and under His feet there appeared to be a pavement of sapphire, as clear as the sky itself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet He did not reach out with His hand against the nobles of the sons of Israel; and they saw God, and they ate and drank.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord said to Moses, “Come up to Me on the mountain and stay there, and I will give you the stone tablets with the Law and the commandments which I have written for their instruction.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses got up along with Joshua his servant, and Moses went up to the mountain of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the elders he said, “Wait here for us until we return to you. And behold, Aaron and Hur are with you; whoever has a legal matter, have him approach them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses went up to the mountain, and the cloud covered the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: The glory of the Lord settled on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it for six days; and on the seventh day He called to Moses from the midst of the cloud.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to the eyes of the sons of Israel, the appearance of the glory of the Lord was like a consuming fire on the mountain top.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses entered the midst of the cloud as he went up to the mountain; and Moses was on the mountain for forty days and forty nights.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Tell the sons of Israel to take a contribution for Me; from everyone whose heart moves him you shall take My contribution.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the contribution which you are to take from them: gold, silver, and bronze,
speaker: Narrator

text: violet, purple, and scarlet material, fine linen, goat hair,
speaker: Narrator

text: rams’ skins dyed red, fine leather, acacia wood,
speaker: Narrator

text: oil for lighting, balsam oil for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense,
speaker: Narrator

text: onyx stones and setting stones for the ephod and for the breastpiece.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have them construct a sanctuary for Me, so that I may dwell among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to all that I am going to show you as the pattern of the tabernacle and the pattern of all its furniture, so you shall construct it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now they shall construct an ark of acacia wood two and a half cubits long, one and a half cubits wide, and one and a half cubits high.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall overlay it with pure gold, inside and out you shall overlay it, and you shall make a gold molding around it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also cast four gold rings for it and fasten them on its four feet; two rings shall be on one side of it, and two rings on the other side of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall make poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark, to carry the ark with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The poles shall remain in the rings of the ark; they shall not be removed from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall put into the ark the testimony which I shall give you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you shall make an atoning cover of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and one and a half cubits wide.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make two cherubim of gold; make them of hammered work at the two ends of the atoning cover.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make one cherub at one end and one cherub at the other end; you shall make the cherubim of one piece with the atoning cover at its two ends.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the cherubim shall have their wings spread upward, covering the atoning cover with their wings and facing one another; the faces of the cherubim are to be turned toward the atoning cover.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall put the atoning cover on top of the ark, and in the ark you shall put the testimony which I will give to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: There I will meet with you; and from above the atoning cover, from between the two cherubim which are upon the ark of the testimony, I will speak to you about every commandment that I will give you for the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall also make a table of acacia wood, two cubits long and one cubit wide, and one and a half cubits high.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall overlay it with pure gold and make a gold border around it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall make for it a rim of a hand width around it; and you shall make a gold border for the rim around it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also make four gold rings for it and put rings on the four corners which are on its four legs.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rings shall be close to the rim, as holders for the poles to carry the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold, so that with them the table may be carried.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also make its dishes, its pans, its jars, and its libation bowls with which to pour drink offerings; you shall make them of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall set the bread of the Presence on the table before Me continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then you shall make a lampstand of pure gold. The lampstand, its base and its shaft, are to be made of hammered work; its cups, its bulbs, and its flowers shall be of one piece with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six branches shall go out from its sides; three branches of the lampstand from its one side and three branches of the lampstand from its other side.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three cups shall be shaped like almond blossoms on the one branch, a bulb and a flower, and three cups shaped like almond blossoms on the other branch, a bulb and a flower—the same for six branches going out from the lampstand;
speaker: Narrator

text: and on the lampstand four cups shaped like almond blossoms, its bulbs and its flowers.
speaker: Narrator

text: A bulb shall be under the first pair of branches coming out of it, and a bulb under the second pair of branches coming out of it, and a bulb under the third pair of branches coming out of it, for the six branches coming out of the lampstand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their bulbs and their branches shall be of one piece with it; all of it shall be one piece of hammered work of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall make its lamps seven in number; and they shall mount its lamps so as to shed light on the space in front of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its tongs and its trays shall be of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be made from a talent of pure gold, with all these utensils.
speaker: Narrator

text: See that you make them by the pattern for them, which was shown to you on the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Moreover, you shall make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twisted linen and violet, purple, and scarlet material; you shall make them with cherubim, the work of a skilled embroiderer.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of each curtain shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits; all the curtains shall have the same measurements.
speaker: Narrator

text: Five curtains shall be joined to one another, and the other five curtains shall be joined to one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make loops of violet on the edge of the outermost curtain in the first set, and likewise you shall make them on the edge of the curtain that is outermost in the second set.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make fifty loops in the one curtain, and you shall make fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that is in the second set; the loops shall be opposite each other.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also make fifty clasps of gold, and join the curtains to one another with the clasps so that the tabernacle will be a unit.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then you shall make curtains of goats’ hair as a tent over the tabernacle; you shall make eleven curtains in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of each curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits; the eleven curtains shall have the same measurements.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall join five curtains by themselves and the other six curtains by themselves, and you shall double over the sixth curtain at the front of the tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that is outermost in the first set, and fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that is outermost in the second set.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall also make fifty clasps of bronze, and you shall put the clasps into the loops and join the tent together so that it will be a unit.
speaker: Narrator

text: The overhanging part that is left over in the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that is left over, shall hang over the back of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cubit on one side and the cubit on the other, of what is left over in the length of the curtains of the tent, shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle on one side and on the other, to cover it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall make a covering for the tent of rams’ skins dyed red and a covering of fine leather above.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then you shall make the boards for the tabernacle of acacia wood, standing upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ten cubits shall be the length of each board and one and a half cubits the width of each board.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall be two tenons for each board, fitted to one another; that is what you shall do for all the boards of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make the boards for the tabernacle: twenty boards for the south side.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make forty bases of silver under the twenty boards, two bases under one board for its two tenons and two bases under another board for its two tenons;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, twenty boards,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their forty bases of silver; two bases under one board and two bases under another board.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the back of the tabernacle, to the west, you shall make six boards.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make two boards for the corners of the tabernacle at the back.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be double beneath, and together they shall be complete to its top to the first ring; this is how it shall be with both of them: they shall form the two corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall be eight boards with their bases of silver, sixteen bases; two bases under one board and two bases under another board.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then you shall make bars of acacia wood, five for the boards of one side of the tabernacle,
speaker: Narrator

text: and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle for the back side to the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: The middle bar in the center of the boards shall pass through from end to end.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall overlay the boards with gold, and make their rings of gold as holders for the bars; and you shall overlay the bars with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall erect the tabernacle according to its plan which you have been shown on the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall also make a veil of violet, purple, and scarlet material, and fine twisted linen; it shall be made with cherubim, the work of a skilled embroiderer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall hang it on four pillars of acacia overlaid with gold, their hooks also of gold, on four bases of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall hang up the veil under the clasps, and bring in the ark of the testimony there within the veil; and the veil shall serve as a partition for you between the Holy Place and the Most Holy Place.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall put the atoning cover on the ark of the testimony in the Most Holy Place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall set the table outside the veil, and the lampstand opposite the table on the side of the tabernacle toward the south; and you shall put the table on the north side.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall also make a curtain for the doorway of the tent of violet, purple, and scarlet material and fine twisted linen, the work of a weaver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall make five pillars of acacia for the curtain and overlay them with gold, their hooks also of gold; and you shall cast five bases of bronze for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now you shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide; the altar shall be square, and its height shall be three cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make its horns on its four corners; its horns shall be of one piece with it, and you shall overlay it with bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall make its pails for removing its ashes, and its shovels, its basins, its forks, and its firepans; you shall make all its utensils of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also make for it a grating, a netting of bronze, and on the netting you shall make four bronze rings at its four corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall put it under the ledge of the altar, so that the netting will reach halfway up the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also make carrying poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood and overlay them with bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its poles shall be inserted into the rings, so that the poles will be on the two sides of the altar when it is carried.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make it hollow with planks; as it was shown to you on the mountain, so they shall make it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now you shall make the courtyard of the tabernacle. On the south side there shall be hangings for the courtyard of fine twisted linen, a hundred cubits long for one side;
speaker: Narrator

text: and its pillars shall be twenty, with their twenty bases of bronze; the hooks of the pillars and their bands shall be of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise for the north side in length there shall be hangings a hundred cubits long, and its twenty pillars with their twenty bases of bronze; the hooks of the pillars and their bands shall be of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the width of the courtyard on the west side shall be hangings of fifty cubits, with their ten pillars and their ten bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: The width of the courtyard on the east side shall be fifty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hangings for the one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and their three bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the other side there shall be hangings of fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and their three bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the gate of the courtyard there shall be a curtain of twenty cubits, of violet, purple, and scarlet material and fine twisted linen, the work of a weaver, with their four pillars and their four bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the pillars around the courtyard shall be joined together with silver, with their hooks of silver and their bases of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of the courtyard shall be a hundred cubits, and the width fifty throughout, and the height five cubits of fine twisted linen, and their bases of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the utensils of the tabernacle used in all its service, and all its pegs, and all the pegs of the courtyard, shall be of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you shall command the sons of Israel that they bring you clear oil of beaten olives for the light, to make a lamp burn continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the tent of meeting, outside the veil which is before the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall keep it in order from evening to morning before the Lord; it shall be a permanent statute throughout their generations for the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then bring forward to yourself your brother Aaron, and his sons with him, from among the sons of Israel, to serve as priest to Me—Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother, for glory and for beauty.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall speak to all the skillful people whom I have endowed with the spirit of wisdom, that they make Aaron’s garments to consecrate him, that he may serve as priest to Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the garments which they shall make: a breastpiece, an ephod, a robe, a tunic of checkered work, a turban, and a sash. They shall make holy garments for your brother Aaron and his sons, so that he may serve as priest to Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall take the gold, the violet, the purple, the scarlet material, and the fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: “They shall also make the ephod of gold, of violet, purple, and scarlet material, and fine twisted linen, the work of the skilled embroiderer.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall have two shoulder pieces joined to its two ends, so that it may be joined.
speaker: Narrator

text: The skillfully woven band of its overlay, which is on it, shall be like its workmanship, of the same material: of gold, of violet and purple and scarlet material and fine twisted linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall take two onyx stones and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: six of their names on the one stone and the names of the remaining six on the other stone, according to their birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a jeweler engraves a signet, you shall engrave the two stones according to the names of the sons of Israel; you shall set them in filigree settings of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall put the two stones on the shoulder pieces of the ephod, as stones of memorial for the sons of Israel, and Aaron shall carry their names before the Lord on his two shoulders as a memorial.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall make filigree settings of gold,
speaker: Narrator

text: and two chains of pure gold; you shall make them of twisted cord work, and you shall put the corded chains on the filigree settings.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make a breastpiece of judgment, the work of a skilled embroiderer; like the work of the ephod you shall make it: of gold, of violet, purple, and scarlet material, and fine twisted linen you shall make it.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be square and folded double, a span in length and a span in width.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall mount on it four rows of stones; the first row shall be a row of ruby, topaz, and emerald;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the second row a turquoise, a sapphire, and a diamond;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the third row a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the fourth row a beryl, and an onyx, and a jasper; they shall be set in gold filigree.
speaker: Narrator

text: The stones shall be engraved according to the names of the sons of Israel: twelve, according to their names; they shall be like the engravings of a signet, each according to his name for the twelve tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also make on the breastpiece twisted chains of cord work in pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall make on the breastpiece two rings of gold, and shall put the two rings on the two ends of the breastpiece.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall put the two cords of gold on the two rings at the ends of the breastpiece.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall put the other two ends of the two cords on the two filigree settings, and put them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod, at the front of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall make two rings of gold and place them on the two ends of the breastpiece, on the edge of it, which is toward the inner side of the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall make two rings of gold and put them on the bottom of the two shoulder pieces of the ephod, on the front of it close to the place where it is joined, above the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall bind the breastpiece by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a violet cord, so that it will be on the skillfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastpiece will not come loose from the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Aaron shall carry the names of the sons of Israel in the breastpiece of judgment over his heart when he enters the Holy Place, as a memorial before the Lord continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall put in the breastpiece of judgment the Urim and the Thummim, and they shall be over Aaron’s heart when he goes in before the Lord; and Aaron shall carry the judgment of the sons of Israel over his heart before the Lord continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make the robe of the ephod all of violet.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall be an opening at its top in the middle of it; around its opening there shall be a binding of woven work, like the opening of a coat of mail, so that it will not be torn.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make on its hem pomegranates of violet, purple, and scarlet material all around on its hem, and bells of gold between them all around:
speaker: Narrator

text: a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, all around on the hem of the robe.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be on Aaron when he ministers; and its sound shall be heard when he enters and leaves the Holy Place before the Lord, so that he will not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall also make a plate of pure gold and engrave on it, like the engravings of a signet, ‘Holy to the Lord.’
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall fasten it on a violet cord, and it shall be on the turban; it shall be at the front of the turban.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be on Aaron’s forehead, and Aaron shall take away the guilt of the holy things which the sons of Israel consecrate, regarding all their holy gifts; and it shall always be on his forehead, so that they may be accepted before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you shall weave the tunic of checkered work of fine linen, and shall make a turban of fine linen, and you shall make a sash, the work of a weaver.
speaker: Narrator

text: “For Aaron’s sons you shall also make tunics; you shall also make sashes for them, and you shall make caps for them, for glory and for beauty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall put them on Aaron your brother and on his sons with him; and you shall anoint them and ordain them and consecrate them, so that they may serve Me as priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make for them linen undergarments to cover their bare flesh; they shall reach from the waist even to the thighs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall be on Aaron and on his sons when they enter the tent of meeting, or when they approach the altar to minister in the Holy Place, so that they do not incur guilt and die. It shall be a statute forever to him and to his descendants after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now this is what you shall do to them to consecrate them to serve as priests to Me: take one bull and two rams without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: and unleavened bread and unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers spread with oil; you shall make them of fine wheat flour.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall put them in one basket, and present them in the basket along with the bull and the two rams.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall bring Aaron and his sons to the doorway of the tent of meeting and wash them with water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall take the garments, and put on Aaron the tunic and the robe of the ephod, and the ephod and the breastpiece, and wrap his waist with the skillfully woven band of the ephod;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall set the turban on his head and put the holy crown on the turban.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall take the anointing oil and pour it on his head, and anoint him.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also bring his sons and put tunics on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall wrap their waists with sashes, Aaron and his sons, and fit caps on them, and they shall have the priesthood by a permanent statute. So you shall ordain Aaron and his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then you shall bring the bull in front of the tent of meeting, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the bull.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall slaughter the bull before the Lord at the doorway of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall take some of the blood of the bull and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger; and you shall pour out all the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall take all the fat that covers the entrails, and the lobe of the liver, and the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, and offer them up in smoke on the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the flesh of the bull and its hide and its refuse, you shall burn with fire outside the camp; it is a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall also take the one ram, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall slaughter the ram and take its blood and sprinkle it around on the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall cut the ram into its pieces, and wash its entrails and its legs, and put them with its pieces and its head.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall offer up in smoke the whole ram on the altar; it is a burnt offering to the Lord: it is a soothing aroma, an offering by fire to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then you shall take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall slaughter the ram, and take some of its blood and put it on the lobe of Aaron’s right ear and on the lobes of his sons’ right ears, and on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet, and sprinkle the rest of the blood around on the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall take some of the blood that is on the altar and some of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it on Aaron and on his garments, and on his sons and on his sons’ garments with him; so he and his garments shall be consecrated, as well as his sons and his sons’ garments with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall also take the fat from the ram and the fat tail, and the fat that covers the entrails and the lobe of the liver, and the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, and the right thigh (for it is a ram of ordination),
speaker: Narrator

text: and one loaf of bread, and one cake of bread mixed with oil, and one wafer from the basket of unleavened bread which is set before the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall put all these in the hands of Aaron and in the hands of his sons, and shall wave them as a wave offering before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall take them from their hands, and offer them up in smoke on the altar on the burnt offering for a soothing aroma before the Lord; it is an offering by fire to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then you shall take the breast of Aaron’s ram of ordination, and wave it as a wave offering before the Lord; and it shall be your portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall consecrate the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the contribution which was waved and which was offered from the ram of ordination, from the one which was for Aaron and from the one which was for his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be for Aaron and his sons as their portion forever from the sons of Israel, for it is a contribution; and it shall be a contribution from the sons of Israel from the sacrifices of their peace offerings, their contribution to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The holy garments of Aaron shall be for his sons after him, so that they may be anointed and ordained in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For seven days the one of his sons who is priest in his place shall put them on when he enters the tent of meeting to minister in the Holy Place.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now you shall take the ram of ordination and boil its flesh in a holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram and the bread that is in the basket, at the doorway of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they shall eat those things by which atonement was made at their ordination and consecration; but a layman shall not eat them, because they are holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if any of the flesh of ordination or any of the bread remains until morning, then you shall burn the remainder with fire; it shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So you shall do for Aaron and for his sons, according to all that I have commanded you; you shall ordain them for seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each day you shall offer a bull as a sin offering for atonement, and you shall purify the altar when you make atonement for it, and you shall anoint it to consecrate it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For seven days you shall make atonement for the altar and consecrate it; then the altar shall be most holy, and whatever touches the altar shall be holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now this is what you shall offer on the altar: two one-year-old lambs each day, continuously.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one lamb you shall offer in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight;
speaker: Narrator

text: and there shall be a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a fourth of a hin of beaten oil, and a fourth of a hin of wine for a drink offering with one lamb.
speaker: Narrator

text: The other lamb you shall offer at twilight, and shall offer with it the same grain offering and the same drink offering as in the morning, for a soothing aroma, an offering by fire to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be a continual burnt offering throughout your generations at the doorway of the tent of meeting before the Lord, where I will meet with you, to speak to you there.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will meet there with the sons of Israel, and it shall be consecrated by My glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will consecrate the tent of meeting and the altar; I will also consecrate Aaron and his sons to serve as priests to Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will dwell among the sons of Israel and will be their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall know that I am the Lord their God who brought them out of the land of Egypt, so that I might dwell among them; I am the Lord their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now you shall make an altar as a place for burning incense; you shall make it of acacia wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its length shall be a cubit, and its width a cubit; it shall be square, and its height shall be two cubits; its horns shall be of one piece with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall overlay it with pure gold, its top and its sides all around, and its horns; and you shall make a gold molding all around for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also make two gold rings for it under its molding; you shall make them on its two sides—on opposite sides—and they shall be holders for poles with which to carry it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall put this altar in front of the veil that is near the ark of the testimony, in front of the atoning cover that is over the ark of the testimony, where I will meet with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron shall burn fragrant incense on it; he shall burn it every morning when he trims the lamps.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Aaron sets up the lamps at twilight, he shall burn incense. There shall be perpetual incense before the Lord throughout your generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not offer any strange incense on this altar, or burnt offering, or meal offering; and you shall not pour out a drink offering on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, Aaron shall make atonement on its horns once a year; he shall make atonement on it with the blood of the sin offering of atonement once a year throughout your generations. It is most holy to the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord also spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you take a census of the sons of Israel to count them, then each one of them shall give a ransom for himself to the Lord, when you count them, so that there will be no plague among them when you count them.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what everyone who is counted shall give: half a shekel according to the shekel of the sanctuary (the shekel is twenty gerahs), half a shekel as a contribution to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who is counted, from twenty years old and over, shall give the contribution to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rich shall not pay more, and the poor shall not pay less, than the half shekel, when you give the contribution to the Lord to make atonement for yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall take the atonement money from the sons of Israel and give it for the service of the tent of meeting, so that it may be a memorial for the sons of Israel before the Lord, to make atonement for yourselves.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall also make a basin of bronze, with its base of bronze, for washing; and you shall put it between the tent of meeting and the altar, and you shall put water in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet from it;
speaker: Narrator

text: when they enter the tent of meeting, they shall wash with water, so that they do not die; or when they approach the altar to minister, by offering up in smoke a fire sacrifice to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they shall wash their hands and their feet, so that they do not die; and it shall be a permanent statute for them, for Aaron and his descendants throughout their generations.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take also for yourself the finest of spices: of liquid myrrh five hundred shekels, and of fragrant cinnamon half as much, 250, and of fragrant cane 250,
speaker: Narrator

text: and of cassia 500, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, and of olive oil a hin.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make from these a holy anointing oil, a fragrant mixture of ointments, the work of a perfumer; it shall be a holy anointing oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall anoint the tent of meeting with it, and the ark of the testimony,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the table and all its utensils, and the lampstand and its utensils, and the altar of incense,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the basin and its stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also consecrate them, so that they may be most holy; whatever touches them shall be holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall anoint Aaron and his sons, and consecrate them, so that they may serve as priests to Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore, you shall speak to the sons of Israel, saying, ‘This shall be a holy anointing oil to Me throughout your generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall not be poured on anyone’s body, nor shall you make any like it in the same proportions; it is holy, and it shall be holy to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever mixes any like it or whoever puts any of it on a layman shall be cut off from his people.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Take for yourself spices—stacte, onycha, and galbanum, spices and pure frankincense; there shall be an equal part of each.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make incense from it all, a skillful mixture, the work of a perfumer, salted, pure, and holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall crush some of it very fine, and put part of it in front of the testimony in the tent of meeting where I will meet with you; it shall be most holy to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the incense which you shall make, you shall not make in the same proportions for yourselves; it shall be holy to you for the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever makes any like it, to use as perfume, shall be cut off from his people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “See, I have called by name Bezalel, the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have filled him with the Spirit of God in wisdom, in understanding, in knowledge, and in all kinds of craftsmanship,
speaker: Narrator

text: to create artistic designs for work in gold, in silver, and in bronze,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in the cutting of stones for settings, and in the carving of wood, so that he may work in all kinds of craftsmanship.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, I Myself have appointed with him Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and in the hearts of all who are skillful I have put skill, so that they may make everything that I have commanded you:
speaker: Narrator

text: the tent of meeting, the ark of testimony, the atoning cover that is on it, and all the furniture of the tent,
speaker: Narrator

text: the table and its utensils, the pure gold lampstand with all its utensils, and the altar of incense,
speaker: Narrator

text: the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the basin and its stand,
speaker: Narrator

text: the woven garments as well: the holy garments for Aaron the priest and the garments of his sons, with which to carry out their priesthood;
speaker: Narrator

text: the anointing oil also, and the fragrant incense for the Holy Place, they are to make them according to everything that I have commanded you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now as for you, speak to the sons of Israel, saying, ‘You must keep My Sabbaths; for this is a sign between Me and you throughout your generations, so that you may know that I am the Lord who sanctifies you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore you are to keep the Sabbath, for it is holy to you. Everyone who profanes it must be put to death; for whoever does any work on it, that person shall be cut off from among his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For six days work may be done, but on the seventh day there is a Sabbath of complete rest, holy to the Lord; whoever does any work on the Sabbath day must be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the sons of Israel shall keep the Sabbath, to celebrate the Sabbath throughout their generations as a permanent covenant.’
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a sign between Me and the sons of Israel forever; for in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, but on the seventh day He ceased from labor, and was refreshed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When He had finished speaking with him on Mount Sinai, He gave Moses the two tablets of the testimony, tablets of stone, written by the finger of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the people saw that Moses delayed to come down from the mountain, the people assembled around Aaron and said to him, “Come, make us a god who will go before us; for this Moses, the man who brought us up from the land of Egypt—we do not know what happened to him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron said to them, “Tear off the gold rings which are in the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters, and bring them to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the people tore off the gold rings which were in their ears and brought them to Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he took the gold from their hands, and fashioned it with an engraving tool and made it into a cast metal calf; and they said, “This is your god, Israel, who brought you up from the land of Egypt.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Aaron saw this, he built an altar in front of it; and Aaron made a proclamation and said, “Tomorrow shall be a feast to the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the next day they got up early and offered burnt offerings, and brought peace offerings; and the people sat down to eat and to drink, and got up to engage in lewd behavior.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, “Go down at once, for your people, whom you brought up from the land of Egypt, have behaved corruptly.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have quickly turned aside from the way which I commanded them. They have made for themselves a cast metal calf, and have worshiped it and have sacrificed to it and said, ‘This is your god, Israel, who brought you up from the land of Egypt!’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “I have seen this people, and behold, they are an obstinate people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So now leave Me alone, that My anger may burn against them and that I may destroy them; and I will make of you a great nation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses pleaded with the Lord his God, and said, “Lord, why does Your anger burn against Your people whom You have brought out from the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should the Egyptians talk, saying, ‘With evil motives He brought them out, to kill them on the mountains and to destroy them from the face of the earth’? Turn from Your burning anger and relent of doing harm to Your people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, Your servants to whom You swore by Yourself, and said to them, ‘I will multiply your descendants as the stars of the heavens, and all this land of which I have spoken I will give to your descendants, and they shall inherit it forever.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord relented of the harm which He said He would do to His people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses turned and went down from the mountain with the two tablets of the testimony in his hand, tablets which were written on both sides; they were written on one side and the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tablets were God’s work, and the writing was God’s writing engraved on the tablets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Joshua heard the sound of the people as they shouted, he said to Moses, “There is a sound of war in the camp.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he said,
“It is not the sound of the cry of victory,
Nor is it the sound of the cry of defeat;
But I hear the sound of singing.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came about, as soon as Moses approached the camp, that he saw the calf and the people dancing; and Moses’ anger burned, and he threw the tablets from his hands and shattered them to pieces at the foot of the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he took the calf which they had made and completely burned it with fire, and ground it to powder, and scattered it over the surface of the water and made the sons of Israel drink it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said to Aaron, “What did this people do to you, that you have brought such a great sin upon them?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron said, “Do not let the anger of my lord burn; you know the people yourself, that they are prone to evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they said to me, ‘Make a god for us who will go before us; for this Moses, the man who brought us up from the land of Egypt—we do not know what happened to him.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So I said to them, ‘Whoever has any gold, let them tear it off.’ Then they gave it to me, and I threw it into the fire, and out came this calf.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Moses saw that the people were out of control—for Aaron had let them get out of control to the point of being an object of ridicule among their enemies—
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses then stood at the gate of the camp, and said, “Whoever is for the Lord, come to me!” And all the sons of Levi gathered together to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel says: ‘Every man of you put his sword on his thigh, and go back and forth from gate to gate in the camp, and kill every man his brother, and every man his friend, and every man his neighbor.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the sons of Levi did as Moses instructed, and about three thousand men of the people fell that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said, “Dedicate yourselves today to the Lord—for every man has been against his son and against his brother—in order that He may bestow a blessing upon you today.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the next day Moses said to the people, “You yourselves have committed a great sin; and now I am going up to the Lord; perhaps I can make atonement for your sin.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses returned to the Lord and said, “Oh, this people has committed a great sin, and they have made a god of gold for themselves!
speaker: Narrator

text: But now, if You will forgive their sin, very well; but if not, please wipe me out from Your book which You have written!”
speaker: Narrator

text: However, the Lord said to Moses, “Whoever has sinned against Me, I will wipe him out of My book.
speaker: Narrator

text: But go now, lead the people where I told you. Behold, My angel shall go before you; nevertheless on the day when I punish, I will punish them for their sin.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord struck the people with a plague, because of what they did with the calf which Aaron had made.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, “Depart, go up from here, you and the people whom you have brought up from the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, ‘To your descendants I will give it.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will send an angel before you and I will drive out the Canaanite, the Amorite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go up to a land flowing with milk and honey; for I will not go up in your midst, because you are an obstinate people, and I might destroy you on the way.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the people heard this sad word, they went into mourning, and none of them put on his jewelry.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord had said to Moses, “Say to the sons of Israel, ‘You are an obstinate people; if I were to go up in your midst for just one moment, I would destroy you. So now, take off your jewelry that I may know what I shall do to you.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the sons of Israel stripped themselves of their jewelry, from Mount Horeb onward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Moses used to take the tent and pitch it outside the camp, a good distance from the camp, and he called it the tent of meeting. And everyone who sought the Lord would go out to the tent of meeting which was outside the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came about, whenever Moses went out to the tent, that all the people would arise and stand, each at the entrance of his tent, and gaze after Moses until he entered the tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever Moses entered the tent, the pillar of cloud would descend and stand at the entrance of the tent; and the Lord would speak with Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the people saw the pillar of cloud standing at the entrance of the tent, all the people would stand and worship, each at the entrance of his tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord used to speak to Moses face to face, just as a man speaks to his friend. When Moses returned to the camp, his servant Joshua, the son of Nun, a young man, would not depart from the tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said to the Lord, “See, You say to me, ‘Bring up this people!’ But You Yourself have not let me know whom You will send with me. Moreover, You have said, ‘I have known you by name, and you have also found favor in My sight.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now then, if I have found favor in Your sight in any way, please let me know Your ways so that I may know You, in order that I may find favor in Your sight. Consider too, that this nation is Your people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said, “My presence shall go with you, and I will give you rest.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to Him, “If Your presence does not go with us, do not lead us up from here.
speaker: Narrator

text: For how then can it be known that I have found favor in Your sight, I and Your people? Is it not by Your going with us, so that we, I and Your people, may be distinguished from all the other people who are on the face of the earth?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “I will also do this thing of which you have spoken; for you have found favor in My sight and I have known you by name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said, “Please, show me Your glory!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said, “I Myself will make all My goodness pass before you, and will proclaim the name of the Lord before you; and I will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and will show compassion to whom I will show compassion.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He further said, “You cannot see My face, for mankind shall not see Me and live!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said, “Behold, there is a place by Me, and you shall stand there on the rock;
speaker: Narrator

text: and it will come about, while My glory is passing by, that I will put you in the cleft of the rock and cover you with My hand until I have passed by.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will take My hand away and you shall see My back, but My face shall not be seen.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord said to Moses, “Cut out for yourself two stone tablets like the former ones, and I will write on the tablets the words that were on the former tablets which you smashed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So be ready by morning, and come up in the morning to Mount Sinai, and present yourself there to Me on the top of the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And no one is to come up with you, nor let anyone be seen anywhere on the mountain; even the flocks and the herds are not to graze in front of that mountain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he cut out two stone tablets like the former ones, and Moses got up early in the morning and went up to Mount Sinai, as the Lord had commanded him, and he took the two stone tablets in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord descended in the cloud and stood there with him as he called upon the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord passed by in front of him and proclaimed, “The Lord, the Lord God, compassionate and merciful, slow to anger, and abounding in faithfulness and truth;
speaker: Narrator

text: who keeps faithfulness for thousands, who forgives wrongdoing, violation of His Law, and sin; yet He will by no means leave the guilty unpunished, inflicting the punishment of fathers on the children and on the grandchildren to the third and fourth generations.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses hurried to bow low toward the ground and worship.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, “If in any way I have found favor in Your sight, Lord, please may the Lord go along in our midst, even though the people are so obstinate, and pardon our wrongdoing and our sin, and take us as Your own possession.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God said, “Behold, I am going to make a covenant. Before all your people I will perform miracles which have not been produced in all the earth nor among any of the nations; and all the people among whom you live will see the working of the Lord, for it is a fearful thing that I am going to perform with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Be sure to comply with what I am commanding you this day: behold, I am going to drive out the Amorite from you, and the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be careful that you do not make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land into which you are going, or it will become a snare in your midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: But rather, you are to tear down their altars and smash their memorial stones, and cut down their Asherim
speaker: Narrator

text: —for you shall not worship any other god, because the Lord, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God—
speaker: Narrator

text: otherwise you might make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, and they would prostitute themselves with their gods and sacrifice to their gods, and someone might invite you to eat of his sacrifice,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you might take some of his daughters for your sons, and his daughters might prostitute themselves with their gods and cause your sons also to prostitute themselves with their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not make for yourself any gods cast in metal.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread. For seven days you are to eat unleavened bread, as I commanded you, at the appointed time in the month of Abib; for in the month of Abib you came out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The firstborn from every womb belongs to Me, and all your male livestock, the firstborn from cattle and sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall redeem with a lamb the firstborn from a donkey; and if you do not redeem it, then you shall break its neck. You shall redeem all the firstborn of your sons. None are to appear before Me empty-handed.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall work six days, but on the seventh day you shall rest; even during plowing time and harvest you shall rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall celebrate the Feast of Weeks, that is, the first fruits of the wheat harvest, and the Feast of Ingathering at the turn of the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three times a year all your males are to appear before the Lord God, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will drive out nations from you and enlarge your borders, and no one will covet your land when you go up three times a year to appear before the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with leavened bread, nor is the sacrifice of the Feast of the Passover to be left over until morning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“You shall bring the very first of the first fruits of your soil into the house of the Lord your God.
“You shall not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Write down these words, for in accordance with these words I have made a covenant with you and with Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he was there with the Lord for forty days and forty nights; he did not eat bread or drink water. And He wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the Ten Commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came about, when Moses was coming down from Mount Sinai (and the two tablets of the testimony were in Moses’ hand as he was coming down from the mountain), that Moses did not know that the skin of his face shone because of his speaking with Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when Aaron and all the sons of Israel saw Moses, behold, the skin of his face shone, and they were afraid to approach him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses called to them, and Aaron and all the rulers in the congregation returned to him; and Moses spoke to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward all the sons of Israel came near, and he commanded them to do everything that the Lord had spoken to him on Mount Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses had finished speaking with them, he put a veil over his face.
speaker: Narrator

text: But whenever Moses went in before the Lord to speak with Him, he would take off the veil until he came out; and whenever he came out and spoke to the sons of Israel what he had been commanded,
speaker: Narrator

text: the sons of Israel would see the face of Moses, that the skin of Moses’ face shone. So Moses would put the veil back over his face until he went in to speak with Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses assembled all the congregation of the sons of Israel, and said to them, “These are the things that the Lord has commanded you to do:
speaker: Narrator

text: “For six days work may be done, but on the seventh day you shall have a holy day, a Sabbath of complete rest to the Lord; whoever does any work on it shall be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not kindle a fire in any of your dwellings on the Sabbath day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses spoke to all the congregation of the sons of Israel, saying, “This is the thing which the Lord has commanded, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Take from among you a contribution to the Lord; whoever is of a willing heart is to bring it as the Lord’s contribution: gold, silver, and bronze,
speaker: Narrator

text: and violet, purple, and scarlet material, fine linen, goats’ hair,
speaker: Narrator

text: and rams’ skins dyed red, and fine leather, and acacia wood,
speaker: Narrator

text: and oil for lighting, and spices for the anointing oil, and for the fragrant incense,
speaker: Narrator

text: and onyx stones and setting stones for the ephod and for the breastpiece.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Have every skillful person among you come and make all that the Lord has commanded:
speaker: Narrator

text: the tabernacle, its tent and its covering, its hooks and its boards, its bars, its pillars, and its bases;
speaker: Narrator

text: the ark and its poles, the atoning cover, and the covering curtain;
speaker: Narrator

text: the table and its poles, and all its utensils, and the bread of the Presence;
speaker: Narrator

text: the lampstand also for the light and its utensils and its lamps, and the oil for the light;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the altar of incense and its poles, and the anointing oil and the fragrant incense, and the curtain for the doorway at the entrance of the tabernacle;
speaker: Narrator

text: the altar of burnt offering with its bronze grating, its poles, and all its utensils, the basin and its stand;
speaker: Narrator

text: the hangings of the courtyard, its pillars and its bases, and the curtain for the gate of the courtyard;
speaker: Narrator

text: the pegs of the tabernacle and the pegs of the courtyard and their ropes;
speaker: Narrator

text: the woven garments for ministering in the Holy Place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest and the garments of his sons, to serve as priests.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the congregation of the sons of Israel departed from Moses’ presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: And everyone whose heart stirred him and everyone whose spirit moved him came and brought the Lord’s contribution for the work of the tent of meeting and for all its service, and for the holy garments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all whose hearts moved them, both men and women, came and brought brooches and earrings and signet rings and bracelets, all articles of gold; so did everyone who presented an offering of gold to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who was in possession of violet, purple, or scarlet material or fine linen or goats’ hair, or rams’ skins dyed red or fine leather, brought them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who could make a contribution of silver and bronze brought the Lord’s contribution; and everyone who was in possession of acacia wood for any work of the service brought it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the skilled women spun with their hands, and brought what they had spun, in violet, purple, and scarlet material, and in fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the women whose heart stirred with a skill spun the goats’ hair.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rulers, moreover, brought the onyx stones and the stones for setting for the ephod and for the breastpiece;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the spice and the oil for the light and for the anointing oil, and for the fragrant incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites, all the men and women, whose heart moved them to bring material for all the work, which the Lord had commanded through Moses to be done, brought a voluntary offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said to the sons of Israel, “See, the Lord has called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He has filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, in knowledge, and in all craftsmanship;
speaker: Narrator

text: to create designs for working in gold, in silver, and in bronze,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in the cutting of stones for settings and in the carving of wood, so as to perform in every inventive work.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also has put in his heart to teach, both he and Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has filled them with skill to perform every work of an engraver, of a designer, and of an embroiderer, in violet, purple, and in scarlet material, and in fine linen, and of a weaver, as performers of every work and makers of designs.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now Bezalel, Oholiab, and every skillful person in whom the Lord has put skill and understanding to know how to perform all the work in the construction of the sanctuary, shall perform in accordance with everything that the Lord has commanded.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses called Bezalel, Oholiab, and every skillful person in whom the Lord had put skill, everyone whose heart stirred him, to come to the work to perform it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They received from Moses every contribution which the sons of Israel had brought to perform the work in the construction of the sanctuary. And they still continued bringing to him voluntary offerings every morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the skillful people who were performing all the work of the sanctuary came, each from the work which they were performing,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they said to Moses, “The people are bringing much more than enough for the construction work which the Lord commanded us to perform.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses issued a command, and circulated a proclamation throughout the camp, saying, “No man or woman is to perform work any longer for the contributions of the sanctuary.” So the people were restrained from bringing any more.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the material they had was sufficient and more than enough for all the work, to perform it.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the skillful people among those who were performing the work made the tabernacle with ten curtains; of fine twisted linen and violet, purple, and scarlet material, with cherubim, the work of a skilled embroiderer, Bezalel made them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of each curtain was twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits; all the curtains had the same measurements.
speaker: Narrator

text: He joined five curtains to one another, and the other five curtains he joined to one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made loops of violet on the edge of the outermost curtain in the first set; he did likewise on the edge of the curtain that was outermost in the second set.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made fifty loops in the one curtain, and he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was in the second set; the loops were opposite each other.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made fifty clasps of gold, and joined the curtains to one another with the clasps, so that the tabernacle was a unit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made curtains of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle; he made eleven curtains in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of each curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits was the width of each curtain; the eleven curtains had the same measurements.
speaker: Narrator

text: He joined five curtains by themselves, and the other six curtains by themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was outermost in the first set, and he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was outermost in the second set.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made fifty clasps of bronze to join the tent together so that it would be a unit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made a covering for the tent of rams’ skins dyed red, and a covering of fine leather above.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the boards for the tabernacle of acacia wood, standing upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ten cubits was the length of each board, and one and a half cubits the width of each board.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were two tenons for each board, fitted to one another; he did this to all the boards of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he made the boards for the tabernacle: twenty boards for the south side;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he made forty bases of silver under the twenty boards; two bases under one board for its two tenons, and two bases under another board for its two tenons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then for the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, he made twenty boards,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their forty bases of silver; two bases under one board, and two bases under another board.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the back of the tabernacle, to the west, he made six boards.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made two boards for the corners of the tabernacle at the back.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were double beneath, and together they were complete to its top, to the first ring; he did this with both of them for the two corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were eight boards with their bases of silver, sixteen bases, two bases under every board.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made bars of acacia wood, five for the boards of one side of the tabernacle,
speaker: Narrator

text: and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the back side to the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the middle bar to pass through in the center of the boards from end to end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold as holders for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, he made the veil of violet, purple, and scarlet material, and fine twisted linen; he made it with cherubim, the work of a skilled embroiderer.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made four pillars of acacia for it, and overlaid them with gold, with their hooks of gold; and he cast four bases of silver for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made a curtain for the doorway of the tent, of violet, purple, and scarlet material, and fine twisted linen, the work of a weaver;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he made its five pillars with their hooks, and he overlaid their tops and their bands with gold; but their five bases were of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood; its length was two and a half cubits, its width one and a half cubits, and its height one and a half cubits;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he overlaid it with pure gold inside and out, and made a gold molding for it all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cast four rings of gold for it on its four feet; two rings on one side of it, and two rings on the other side of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark, to carry it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made an atoning cover of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and one and a half cubits wide.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made two cherubim of gold; he made them of hammered work at the two ends of the atoning cover:
speaker: Narrator

text: one cherub at the one end and one cherub at the other end; he made the cherubim of one piece with the atoning cover at the two ends.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the cherubim had their wings spread upward, covering the atoning cover with their wings, with their faces toward each other; the faces of the cherubim were toward the atoning cover.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the table of acacia wood, two cubits long, a cubit wide, and one and a half cubits high.
speaker: Narrator

text: He overlaid it with pure gold, and made a gold molding for it all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made a rim for it of a hand width all around, and made a gold molding for its rim all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also cast four gold rings for it and put the rings on the four corners that were on its four legs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Close by the rim were the rings, the holders for the poles to carry the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold, to carry the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made the utensils which were on the table, its dishes, its pans, its libation bowls, and its jars, with which to pour out drink offerings, of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the lampstand of pure gold. He made the lampstand of hammered work, its base and its shaft; its cups, its bulbs, and its flowers were of one piece with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were six branches going out of its sides; three branches of the lampstand from the one side of it and three branches of the lampstand from the other side of it;
speaker: Narrator

text: three cups shaped like almond blossoms, a bulb and a flower on one branch, and three cups shaped like almond blossoms, a bulb and a flower on the other branch—so for the six branches going out of the lampstand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the lampstand there were four cups shaped like almond blossoms, its bulbs and its flowers;
speaker: Narrator

text: and a bulb was under the first pair of branches coming out of it, and a bulb under the second pair of branches coming out of it, and a bulb under the third pair of branches coming out of it, for the six branches coming out of the lampstand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their bulbs and their branches were of one piece with it; the whole of it was a single hammered work of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made its seven lamps with its tongs and its trays of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made it and all its utensils from a talent of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the altar of incense of acacia wood: a cubit long and a cubit wide, square, and two cubits high; its horns were of one piece with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he overlaid it with pure gold, its top and its sides all around, and its horns; and he made a gold molding for it all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made two golden rings for it under its molding, on its two sides—on opposite sides—as holders for poles with which to carry it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the holy anointing oil and the pure, fragrant incense of spices, the work of a perfumer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood, five cubits long, and five cubits wide, square, and three cubits high.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made its horns on its four corners, its horns being of one piece with it, and he overlaid it with bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made all the utensils of the altar, the pails, the shovels, the basins, the meat-forks, and the firepans; he made all its utensils of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made for the altar a grating of bronze netting beneath, under its ledge, reaching halfway up.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also cast four rings on the four ends of the bronze grating as holders for the poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he inserted the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar, with which to carry it. He made it hollow with planks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, he made the basin of bronze with its base of bronze, from the mirrors of the serving women who served at the doorway of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the courtyard: for the south side the hangings of the courtyard were of fine twisted linen, a hundred cubits;
speaker: Narrator

text: their twenty pillars, and their twenty bases, were made of bronze; the hooks of the pillars and their bands were of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the north side there were a hundred cubits; their twenty pillars and their twenty bases were of bronze, the hooks of the pillars and their bands were of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the west side there were hangings of fifty cubits with their ten pillars and their ten bases; the hooks of the pillars and their bands were of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the east side, fifty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hangings for the one side of the gate were fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and their three bases,
speaker: Narrator

text: and so for the other side. On both sides of the gate of the courtyard were hangings of fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and their three bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the hangings of the courtyard all around were of fine twisted linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the bases for the pillars were of bronze, the hooks of the pillars and their bands, of silver; and the overlaying of their tops, of silver, and all the pillars of the courtyard were furnished with silver bands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the curtain of the gate of the courtyard was the work of the weaver, of violet, purple, and scarlet material and fine twisted linen. And the length was twenty cubits and the height was five cubits, corresponding to the hangings of the courtyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their four pillars and their four bases were of bronze; their hooks were of silver, and the overlaying of their tops and their bands were of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the pegs of the tabernacle and of the courtyard all around were of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the number of the things for the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the testimony, as they were counted according to the command of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made everything that the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: With him was Oholiab the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver and a skilled embroiderer, and a weaver in violet, in purple, and in scarlet material, and fine linen.
speaker: Narrator
